page.title: 05Ecology - Lake shore.
page.content: The whole shoreline of Windermere is under great pressure where there is public access. Most of the 1.5km. of it which does lie in the survey area, near Millerground,is owned by the National Trust. They have provided a car park, toilets, picnic area and jetties. Two large wooden huts are leased to Cumbria Education Committee for use as a water activities base. (see "Recreation") Pollution of the lake and the shore line used to be a major problem, largely as a result of effluent being discharged from boats, but this has now been banned and the consequent improvement has benefited all lake users. Noise is perhaps now the main form of environmental pollution, especially from low flying jet aircraft and also from speed boats. Ashore, litter is always a problem.
